lead_paragraph: According to the indictment, the employees, including the C.E.O., offered bribes to doctors to get them to prescribe more of the company’s product, Subsys.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Insys Executives Are Charged in a Scheme to Push Its Addictive Painkiller
headline.main: Former Insys Officials Charged in Scheme to Push Its Painkiller

snippet: According to the indictment, the employees, including the C.E.O., offered bribes to doctors to get them to prescribe more of the company’s product, Subsys....
abstract: Federal prosecutors charge six former employees of Insys Therapeutics pharmaceutical company with racketeering; firm's former chief exec Michael L Babich and five others allegedly offered bribes and kickbacks to pain doctors in several states in order to increase sales of Subsys, spray form of highly addictive opioid fentanyl.
